intro: Rhynchanthera dichotoma, commonly known as the dichotomous rhynchanthera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, branching inflorescence. The plant features showy, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette. Rhynchanthera dichotoma is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
